intro: Dendroseris, commonly known as the tree dandelion, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its upright, often woody stems and basal rosettes of leaves. The flowers are typically yellow and arranged in a single head, surrounded by bracts. Dendroseris species are found primarily in arid and semi-arid regions of the Americas. These plants are adapted to survive in harsh environments, often with deep root systems and succulent leaves.
